2:
"How long will you make me suffer
\q and break me into pieces with words?
4:
If it is indeed true that I have erred,
\q my error remains my own concern.
5:
If indeed you will exalt yourselves above me
\q and use my humiliation against me, 
\q
6:
then you should know that God has done wrong to me
\q and has caught me in his net.
7:
See, I cry out, "Violence!" but I get no answer.
\q I call out for help, but there is no justice.
\q
8:
He has walled up my way so that I cannot pass,
\q and he has set darkness in my path.
\q
9:
He has stripped me of my glory,
\q and he has taken the crown from my head.
14:
My kinsfolk have failed me;
\q my close friends have forgotten me.
16:
I call to my servant, but he gives me no answer
\q although I entreat him with my mouth.
19:
All my familiar friends abhor me;
\q those whom I love have turned against me.
21:
Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, my friends,
\q for the hand of God has touched me.
\q
22:
Why do you persecute me as if you were God?
\q Why are you not satisfied with consuming my flesh?
23:
Oh, that my words were now written down!
\q Oh, that they were inscribed in a book!
\q
24:
Oh, that with an iron pen and lead
\q they were engraved in the rock forever!
26:
after my skin, that is, this body, is destroyed,
\q then in my flesh I will see God.
\q
28:
If you say, 'How we will persecute him!
\q The root of his troubles lies in him,'
\q
29:
then be afraid of the sword,
\q because wrath brings the punishment of the sword,
\q so that you may know there is a judgment."
